title: @Riot Can we expect a new legendary skin maybe before the end of september?

replies.body:
Hey Jensus,

In regards to skins, we tend to veer away from announcing which champions will be getting a skin next, what that skin might be, and in cases like you've mentioned, if a legendary or ultimate skin is coming soon (tm). 

There are a few reasons why we do this - the biggest one being we don't want to disappoint. 

 If we gave dates ahead of time, we'd occasionally be boxing ourselves into the corner of 'promises we can't keep'.

We've internally pushed back content before due to part of the skin not being ready, or making significant changes to an existing skin. We don't want to rush the content, and sometimes, in order to make the best possible skin, we need more time. 

We've shelved skins before (Guardian of the Sands skins, for the most part, were a year or so old, and we went back to them last summer, made changes, and then shipped them.) This would have been a really bad feeling if over a year ago we said, "Okay, cool, new Rammus skin, guys!", and then you end up waiting over a year to actually see it/play it. 

Another good example was waiting for another Lux skin after Steel Legion. While Star Guardian Lux was (hopefully) worth the wait, it still sucked being told 'new skin soon' and waiting ~two years for another skin.

While I can't give you an ETA, I'd be curious to hear if you had any legendary skin ideas in mind, or at least a champion who could benefit from one.

What champion could use a legendary skin is an interesting question.  There are plenty of champions who could use more skins, but legendary skins are special.

My personal vote would be for Garen, and yes I have a reason for it beyond me being a Garen main.

Garen has a fair number of skins, but very few of them match Garen thematically.  Garen is a classic law abiding good guy, and none of his skins really show that.  In fact the best he has alignment wise are neutral skins, and that's not even mentioning the evil looking ones.

Perhaps a legendary skin is a bit out of the question (he did just get a skin after all), but something that shows Garen off as the paragon of Demacia he is supposed to be would be a nice change.

I agree - legendaries (and ultimates) really push the boundaries of a champion. 

Garen is an interesting choice. 

Let me pose this question to you - would you rather have a lesser tier skin, let's say 975 RP, that shows the type of Garen you've described above, or would you rather take the chance on a legendary skin to really break free of an ordinary Garen. Maybe he's mecha? Maybe you can dress him up in armor before the game (treading in more ultimate skins areas)?

While I would absolutely love a legendary or ultimate skin for my main, and as much as it pains me to say this, I supposed I would rather have the lesser tier skin.

From my perspective at least the high tier skins really fit with an aspect of who their champion is, but that's not exactly a requirement for the skins.  I would, of course, prefer one that does both, but if I had to choose between a garen-teed good guy skin or a possibly good guy but legendary skin I would choose the lower tier.

Mecha or custom armor would be very interesting, but at the end of the day it's only a matter of whether or not he is that paragon of Demacia he is supposed to be.  However I suppose these are not mutually exclusive, Mecha-Paragon Garen would be a curious sight.
Let's not forget about [Unprepared Garen](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/skin-champion-concepts/EsVELEHf-unprepared-garen-riot-pls-ultimate-skin-concept) now.
I have to ask if you feel a Police officer Garen skin would work with your idea of law abiding good guy.

That would definitely cover the "law" part, but Garen is pretty much THE example of Demacian ethics.  You do what is right because it is right.  He represents the side of Demacia that Demacia wants the world to see.

There is a darker side to Demacia too, however according to everything that has been shown in the lore Garen, along with most of Demacia, turns a blind eye to it in favor of the propaganda.

It would definitely make for an interesting skin, as Garen's quotes could easily be made to fit that style, but it doesn't quite fit what I'm asking for.

I feel that either {{champion:57}}  or {{champion:13}} , given the amount of pro play they have seen and how many people are playing them again, would benefit from a legendary skin pretty well. They have both seen quite a bit of pro play recently and are almost either pick/ban in lcs. Pretty common pickups and generally fun champions to play.

Aside from skins like Championship and Victorious, we don't really take popularity into account. Instead, we focus more on champions who need skins, or champions who could fit into a really cool thematic we're looking to build - something for an event such as Lunar Revel. 

I would love to see a Maokai legendary skin - he has a lot going on in terms of kit, models and particles.

> What kind of references would you use for Arcade Zed/Mini Boss-esque Zed?

How about we take "Arcade Zed" a bit farther and turn it into "Raver Zed"?

Q = Shurikens are now glowsticks. Every time you use Q, Zed throws a pair different colored glowsticks, colors chosen randomly.

W = Zed makes a clone of himself that slowly glows different dark colors.

E = Zed creates a burst of dark rave lights around him. The colors of the lights change every time you use the ability, chosen randomly.

R = Rave lights surround Zed and the target he's ulting. Once he lands, a disco ball appears above the target and party punk music starts playing originating from the target. The disco ball emits dark rave lights as it rotates above the target. After three seconds the disco ball explodes in a flash of dark lights.

Recall = Zed makes the same gestures but instead of little emblems appearing around him, glowsticks appear instead, each one a random color.

No more helmet, face is exposed. Eyes are still glowing red. Wearing typical raver/punk outfit. Face is partially tattooed, right arm is fully tattooed. Wearing a red jacket with no undershirt, exposing chest. Skinny black jeans with pocket chain.

I think that suits Arcade's idea of having a bunch of fun colors, without going into 2D effects, trading them instead for glowing effects and cool music.
